results.title: Circling the globe in comfort
results.creator_credit: Jaaf Nieuwenhuis and Royal Rotterdam Lloyd
results.brief_description: Historical documentary of a round-the-world trip by the 23,000 ton Dutch liner, the “Willem Ruys”, beginning from Sydney and calling into Wellington (NZ), Lima (Peru), Balboa (Panama City), Miami, Bermuda, Southampton, Rotterdam, passing Portugal, Gibraltar and Malta to Port Said and into the Suez Canal. From the Suez Canal the voyage then continues on through the Red Sea to aden, into the Indian Ocean to Colombo, then Singapore, across the Equator past Java and Christmas Island to Cape Leeuwin and finally arriving in Melbourne.
results.description: Historical documentary of a round-the-world trip by the 23,000 ton Dutch liner, the “Willem Ruys”, beginning from Sydney and calling into Wellington (NZ), Lima (Peru), Balboa (Panama City), Miami, Bermuda, Southampton, Rotterdam, passing Portugal, Gibraltar and Malta to Port Said and into the Suez Canal. results.title: Autumn: a concept film
results.brief_description: A short experimental film which focuses on one tree as it loses its leaves during the autumn season. We watch until finally the last leaf falls and the tree is completely bare. Without commentary but accompanied with music. No other credits available.

results.title: The 1956 Olympic story [Winter Olympics in Cortina, Italy]
results.creator_credit: Norman Mackay, Harry Leaman and Helms Athletic Foundation

video_links.name: The 1956 Olympic story [Winter Olympics in Cortina, Italy]

results.brief_description: Documentary film on the Olympic Winter Games in Cortina in the Italian Alps, 1956. Sets the panoramic views of Cortina and the venues where the 1956 Winter games will be held whilst highlighting the previous 1952 Oslo Winter games with footage of specific events. Also includes footage of Melbourne in 1956 featuring the Melbourne Cricket Ground and St Kilda Town Hall and images of the 1952 Summer games in Helsinki. Narrated by Fred Hessler.

results.title: Wildflower Wonderland
results.brief_description: Informational travelogue on the Grampians National Park focussing mainly on the diversity of flora in and around the area and interspersed with scenes of people bushwalking some of the well-known tracks available.

results.title: [New Zealand Weekly Review. No. 201]
results.brief_description: Newreel items include: 1. UNRRA. Clothes for Europe, loading stores for refugees in Europe. 2. Hastings - Spring show. 3. Temuka - Bailey Bridge in Civvies. Wartime Bailey Bridge erected to help country area. 4. From war to peace - returned servicemen train for the building industry. 5. McKenzie Country - down from the tops.

results.title: Wine service: a guide for professional waiters
results.creator_credit: John Kingsford-Smith, Australian Wine and Brandy Corporation and Kingcroft Productions
results.brief_description: Produced by the Australian Wine Board, this work features the skills and knowledge required for wine waiting. A short instructional film, it aims to assist in making the right selection of wine varieties to match with food, relying on the knowledge of the restaurant staff. Get the insider knowledge from inside the waiters’ pantry: “it’s important you have a sound knowledge of your foods, and more particularly of your wines”.

results.title: The Battle against cancer
results.creator_credit: American Cancer Society and Swiss Society for Combating Cancer
results.brief_description: Prepared for lay audiences this film states that in any typical large group of Americans, one in every eight will die of cancer. To combat the high mortality caused by cancer, early treatment by X-ray, radium or surgery is essential. Microscope-slides are used in this film to show normal cell division and growth, and then the invasion of cancer cells breeding wildly.

results.title: Trip to Mars
results.brief_description: Magical animation details the extraterrestial adventures of hand-drawn harlequin, Koko the clown. Reluctant astronaut Koko inadvertantly launches Mr. Fleischer skyward and the two conclude their supernatural reverie in a ‘taxi-crab’ flung to the rings of Saturn. Koko’s martian odyssey reveals a wealth of unlikely and outlandish natives.

results.title: Make the Most of Your Roast
results.creator_credit: Robert Knapp and Meat and Livestock Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Meat makes the meal”.
Produced for the Australian Meat Board, this film demonstrates clearly and simply the steps essential in making a good roast. Tips such as keeping the oven temperature low, placing the meat on a grill and using a meat thermometer are explained and demonstrated.
